metadata.title: CVE-2023-48795 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Prefix truncation attack on BPP: By manipulating sequence numbers duringthe handshake, an attacker can remove the initial messages on the securechannel without causing a MAC failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-48795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6
openssh-server - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6
openssh-sftp-server - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6
openssh-tests - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6
ssh - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6
No subscription required

libssh-4 - 0.10.4-2ubuntu0.2
libssh-gcrypt-4 - 0.10.4-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

libssh2-1 - 1.10.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.0p1-1ubuntu8.6').
dropbear package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
golang-go.crypto package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
snapd package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
libssh package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.4-2ubuntu0.2').
libssh2 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-3').
openssh-ssh1 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
paramiko package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
putty package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
proftpd-dfsg package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
python-asyncssh package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
